About Me

Every team needs a Landon!

Nickelodeon

Technical Director

Los Angeles, CA

Landon defines what it means to be a "Technical Director". With his core understanding of how DCC software functions, he is a combination resource of consultation, troubleshooting, and tool development. Using various programming languages like Python, javascript, mel, tcl, and vex, Landon develops software extensions for every team in the production. His tools are used not only in-house, but also deployed to overseas teams of 100+ artists. His unique understanding of context makes him a force in production; Always aiming to reduce repetitive tasks down to milliseconds. Landon works closely with Team Leads, Supervisors, and Production teams to generate solutions for their needs. These solutions have allowed the company to push for higher quality products for the last 4 years.

Anima Inc.

Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan

Lighting and Compositing Artist

While in Japan, Landon worked as both a Lighting artist, as well as beginning to put his programming skills to the set with smaller, artist-centric tools. While there, he became introduced to a large assortment of alternative production workflows and softwares not used as commonly in the states. Additionally, he assisted in consultation to help the company shift from 3dsMax to Maya to better establish a "western" influenced pipeline.

Full Sail University

Winter Park, FL

Lab Instructor

Graduating as Valedictorian, Landon was immediately hired as a Lab Instructor for the Finals Department. Because he graduated with an expert's level of undertsanding production, the Demo Reel course was ideal for helping students troubleshoot their portfolio pieces regardless of their skill focus. Conveying and reviewing portfolio and brand quality, troubleshooting assets and techniques for Modeling, Texturing, Rigging, Animating, Look Dev, and Compositing were among many job requirements. Thanks to the inspiration and challenge of co-instructor and friend Heith Seewald, Landon began to program too.
